meanings.definition: An imaginary line dividing something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully drew the midlines on the canvas to create symmetry in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The midlines on the map showed where the equator divides the Earth into two hemispheres.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully sprinkled glitter along the midlines of the cake to make it look magical.
meanings.sent4: The midlines of the political spectrum often blur as opinions become more nuanced.
meanings.sent5: In the game, players must strategically place their pieces along the midlines to maintain balance.

meanings.definition: A line that runs through the middle of something.
meanings.sent1: The midlines of the road help drivers stay in their lanes and drive safely.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with midlines to ensure structural stability.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to nap right on the midlines of the bed, claiming it as her territory.
meanings.sent4: The midlines of the river serve as a natural boundary for different ecosystems.
meanings.sent5: The midlines of the bookshelf were reinforced to support the weight of the books.

meanings.definition: A line that represents the average of two extremes.
meanings.sent1: The midlines on the graph show where the data points converge towards a central value.
meanings.sent2: The midlines of the color spectrum blend the primary colors to create secondary hues.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer used the midlines of contrasting fabrics to create a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: In music, the midlines between major and minor chords can evoke different emotions.
meanings.sent5: The midlines of the temperature range indicate the most common weather conditions in that region.
